newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait firm bought $36 mln Telekom shares.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait firm bought $36 mln Telekom shares.

text.p: Kuwait Investment Company (KIC) said on Tuesday it bought on behalf of clients 54 million marks ($40 million) worth of Deutsche Telekom shares.

KIC's portfolio manager Ibrahim al-Qadhi said in a statement to Reuters his firm was able to meet 27 percent of requests by clients worth 200 million marks to buy shares in the German phone giant in Europe's biggest ever share launch on Monday.

Qadhi had told the Kuwait News Agency on Tuesday that his firm met 70 percent of requests by clients worth 125 million marks but he told Reuters on Wednesday he made a mistake and issued the statement to correct the figures.
The 20 billion mark offering was five times oversubscribed.
The price of Telekom shares dropped five percent at the close of the market in Frankfurt on Tuesday, dropping to 32.07 marks but well above the issue price of 28.50 marks.
It opened at 31.80 marks on Wednesday.
